<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 645, 91]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will determine the weight of a metre rule. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 571, 123]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions referring to Fig. 1.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 128, 794, 230]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 245, 510, 263]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 276, 494, 295]]<|/det|> You are provided with a 1.0 N load, labelled \(\mathbf{X}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 308, 144, 326]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 308, 180, 326]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 306, 875, 342]]<|/det|> Place the load \(\mathbf{X}\) on the rule so that its centre is at \(d = 5.0 \text{cm}\) from the zero end of the rule as shown in Fig. 1.1. Record the value of \(d\) in Table 1.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 354, 180, 373]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 354, 875, 388]]<|/det|> Adjust the position of the rule so that it is as near as possible to being balanced, with the \(50.0 \text{cm}\) mark to the right of the pivot. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 401, 180, 420]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 401, 875, 435]]<|/det|> Measure, and record in the table, the distance \(x\) from the centre of the load \(\mathbf{X}\) to the pivot. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 448, 180, 467]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 448, 875, 481]]<|/det|> Measure, and record in the table, the distance \(y\) from the pivot to the \(50.0 \text{cm}\) mark on the rule. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 494, 181, 512]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 494, 873, 512]]<|/det|> Repeat the steps (i)–(iv) using \(d\) values of \(10.0 \text{cm}\), \(15.0 \text{cm}\), \(20.0 \text{cm}\) and \(25.0 \text{cm}\). <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 523, 517, 542]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 555, 767, 721]]<|/det|>
\(d/ \text{cm}\)\(x/ \text{cm}\)\(y/ \text{cm}\)
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 715, 875, 734]]<|/det|> [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 819, 109]]<|/det|>
Plot the graph of \(y / \text{cm}\) (\(y\)-axis) against \(x / \text{cm}\) (\(x\)-axis). You do not need to include origin (0,0) on your graph.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[845, 559, 875, 578]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 823, 108]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate temperature changes when hot water and cold are mixed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 871, 140]]<|/det|>
You are provided with a supply of hot water and a supply of cold (room temperature) water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 149, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 149, 181, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 149, 636, 170]]<|/det|>
Pour \(100 \text{cm}^3\) of cold water into the beaker labelled \(\mathbf{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 180, 728, 201]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{c}}\) of the water in beaker \(\mathbf{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 210, 880, 231]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\theta_{\mathrm{c}} =\) ................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 241, 181, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 241, 734, 262]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{h}}\) of the hot water supplied.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 272, 880, 293]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\theta_{\mathrm{h}} =\) ................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 303, 180, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 303, 640, 324]]<|/det|>
Add \(100 \text{cm}^3\) of the hot water to the water in beaker \(\mathbf{A}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 333, 824, 355]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{m}}\) of the mixture of hot and cold water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 365, 875, 386]]<|/det|>
<form>\(\theta_{\mathrm{m}} =\) ................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 396, 181, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(iv)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 396, 875, 433]]<|/det|>
State two precautions that you took to ensure the reliability of your value of the temperature \(\theta_{\mathrm{m}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[470, 691, 875, 712]]<|/det|>
<form>average \(\theta_{\mathrm{av}} =\) .................................................. [4]

<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 751, 92]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the reflection of light by a plane mirror.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 571, 123]]<|/det|>
Carry out the following instructions referring to Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[141, 128, 816, 648]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 664, 509, 682]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 694, 146, 712]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 694, 875, 745]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(10\mathrm{cm}\) long near the middle of the ray trace sheet. Label the line \(\mathbf{MR}\). Draw a normal to this line that passes through its centre. Label the normal \(\mathbf{NL}\). Label the point at which \(\mathbf{NL}\) crosses \(\mathbf{MR}\) with the letter \(\mathbf{B}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 757, 146, 775]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 756, 875, 807]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(8\mathrm{cm}\) long from \(\mathbf{B}\) at an angle of incidence \(i = 40^{\circ}\) to the normal below \(\mathbf{MR}\) and to the left of the normal. Label the end of this line \(\mathbf{A}\). Record the angle of incidence \(i\) in Table 4.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 819, 144, 838]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 817, 875, 852]]<|/det|>
Place the mirror, with its reflecting face vertical, on the line \(\mathbf{MR}\). The mirror has a line drawn on it. One end of this line must be at point \(\mathbf{B}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 864, 146, 882]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 864, 321, 882]]<|/det|>
Place a pin \(\mathsf{P}_1\) at \(\mathbf{A}\).
